source.query: sandbag squat to stand muscles worked
source.raw_text:
The Sandbag Seat-to-Stand Lift is a full-body exercise activating major lower body and core muscles, primarily working glutes, quadriceps, hamstrings, and core (abdominals, erector spinae) for power, with assistance from calves, shoulders, and back for stability and movement, using a fundamental hip hinge and knee/hip extension pattern, enhanced by the sandbag's shifting load for core engagement. [1, 2, 3]  
This video demonstrates the proper technique for the sit-to-stand movement: 
Muscles Worked 

• Primary Movers (Legs & Hips): Gluteus Maximus, Quadriceps, Hamstrings. 
• Core & Stability: Abdominals (rectus abdominis, obliques), Erector Spinae (lower back). 
• Stabilizers/Assistants: Calves (gastrocnemius, soleus), Back (lats, traps), Shoulders (deltoids), Forearms/Grip. [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]  

Movement Pattern (Hip Hinge & Squat) 

1. Initial Setup (Hinge): Hinge at the hips, leaning forward to reach the sandbag, engaging glutes and hamstrings to load them. 
2. Push-Off (Extension): Drive through the feet, extending hips and knees (like a squat) to lift the body and bag. 
3. Core Bracing: Throughout, brace the abdominals to create spinal stability and efficient force transfer. 
4. Controlled Descent: Reverse the motion, controlling the movement by bending at the hips and knees as you sit back down. [1, 3, 4, 5]  

**Citations:**

[1] https://www.hingehealth.com/resources/articles/sit-to-stand/
[2] https://www.myhomeforlife.com/From-Sitting-to-Strong-Why-Sit-to-Stand-Lifts-Are-the-Best-s/122.htm
[3] https://brickhousenutrition.com/blogs/articles/sandbag-training-101-is-this-the-ultimate-full-body-workout-tool
[4] https://gymbox.de/en/sandbag-exercise-lift/
[5] https://fitsb.com/blog/sit-to-stand-a-movement-essential-done-well/
[6] https://www.everydayhealth.com/workouts-activities/the-muscles-used-sit-stand/
